title.rendered: Les soins virtuels et vos employés

content.rendered:
Les soins virtuels et vos employés

Un guide complet à propos des soins virtuels pour les employeurs.

Lire le guide

Les soins virtuels transforment les régimes d’avantages sociaux.

Découvrez comment cela fonctionne.

Les soins virtuels sont pratiques, efficaces et de plus en plus utilisés au Canada.

Alors qu’on demande aux Canadiens de pratiquer la distanciation sociale, les soins de santé virtuels sont plus importants que jamais. Des milliers d’employeurs canadiens soutiennent le bien-être physique et mental de leurs employés en ajoutant les soins virtuels à leurs régimes d’avantages sociaux. Découvrez les soins virtuels, pourquoi ceux-ci sont importants pour les employeurs et des concepts tels que « la continuité des soins» et la « la santé mentale virtuelle ».

Points importants à retenir

8,5

Le nombre moyen de jours de congé de maladie pris par un employé par année, ce qui entraîne des coûts d’absence directs de 2 000 $.

76 %

Des Canadiens n’accepteraient pas un emploi si celui-ci n’offre pas un régime d’avantages sociaux solide.

70 %

Des problèmes de santé primaires peuvent être résolus grâce aux soins virtuels.

Moins de 5 min

Le temps d’attente moyen pour parler avec un médecin à partir de Maple.

« L’équipe de Maple nous a très bien soutenu lors du processus de mise en œuvre et de déploiement du programme. L’inscription et l’intégration ont été faciles, et nos employés mentionnent souvent à quel point l’application est facile à utiliser. »

— Jill Doucette, conseillère principale pour les récompenses, ADP

Téléchargez notre guide

Découvrez comment les soins virtuels transforment les régimes d’avantages sociaux des employés.

  • En soumettant les informations ci-dessus, vous acceptez de recevoir des communications de Maple.
  • Ce champ n’est utilisé qu’à des fins de validation et devrait rester inchangé.

Are you a fan of Maple?
Refer us to a company and get rewarded.

Refer us to a company who would be interested in adding Maple to their benefits.

Get $200 if your referral sets up a meeting with Maple.

And get $1,000 if your referral becomes a client with Maple.

Simply fill in the form below before August 15, 2020 with your referral contact details to get started. Offer valid for referred companies with over 150 employees only. Additional conditions may apply.*

* Terms and conditions
Content Period
The Maple Referral Offer begins on June 16, 2020 and ends on August 15, 2020 at 11:59:59 p.m. EST. Eligibility
To be eligible, participants (“referee”) must be an existing Maple user. The Referral Offer is open to residents of Canada who have reached the age of majority in the province in which they reside by the start of the Referral Offer. The company referral must have over 150 employees to be eligible for the offer.

Employees of the Maple sales team are not eligible for the Referral Offer.

Offer Details
Participants will receive $200 (before taxes) if the referred company completes a meeting with Maple before August 15, 2020. Participants will receive $1,000 (before taxes) if the referred company becomes a client of Maple before September 31, 2020. All amounts are in Canadian dollars.

Maple will make a minimum of two (2) attempts to contact the participant via the email address provided in the referral form if the participants referral completes a meeting with Maple and/or signs on to be a Maple client. In order to receive the Referral Offer, participants must respond to Maple’s email notification within five (5) business days of being contacted by Maple.

A disqualification from the Referral Offer and forfeiture of the offer may occur if (i) Maple’s email to the participant is returned as undeliverable, (ii) the email address provided by the participant to Maple is not your correct email address, (iii) participant fails to respond to the email notification within five (5) business days of being contacted by Maple, or (iv) participant failed to comply with these terms and conditions.

At any time, Maple retains the rights in its sole and absolute discretion to, (i) suspend or terminate the Referral Offer, (ii) modify the Referral Offer, (iii) suspend or terminate participation and/or right to participate in the Referral Offer at any time for any reason, (iv) terminate the Referral Offer if we notice any activity that we believe is abusive or fraudulent. Maple has the right but not the obligation to monitor referral activities, and modify referrals as deemed fair and appropriate. Maple accepts no liability as a result of either monitoring or not monitoring referral activities.
Participants agree to indemnify and save Maple, its founders, officers, directors, employees and agents, harmless from and against all liability of whatever nature to which Maple may be subject which arises out of your submission under these terms and conditions, by reason of negligence, fraud, misrepresentation or other acts, errors or omissions for which you are responsible in law.

By entering for this Referral Offer, the participant consents to the collection, use, disclosure, and retention of their personal information as the referee, and consents to the collection, use, disclosure and retention of the referrals information for the purposes of administering the Referral Offer, and fulfillment. For additional information, please see our Privacy Policy page.

As a participant in this Referral Offer, each participant agrees to abide by and be bound by these terms and conditions. Recipients of the offer amount further agrees to abide by and be bound by all decisions of Maple, which shall be final and binding without right of appeal, in all matters related to this Referral Offer and the awarding of the offer, including without limitation eligibility and/or disqualification of entries.

Please refer to our Terms and Conditions page for more information.
